content:
• Thursday, January 21, 2016
  • ALGT

    Allegiant Air names COO, rearranges responsibilities

    • Just a few days after it lost its chief operating officer, Allegiant Air (ALGT -3.6%) has named his replacement along with a management restructuring.
    • Jude Bricker, the company's senior VP of planning, will take over the role of COO and oversee Flight Operations, Maintenance and Safety. He'll continue to lead the network and fleet strategy.
    • CFO Scott Sheldon gets an expanded role in the changes, taking responsibility for Inflight and Operation Control Center, which will include front-line customer-facing employees.
    • The firm had said it would use the resignation of Steve Harfst to "refocus on operational needs and areas for improvement."
    • Previously: Allegiant Air chief operating officer resigns (Jan. 15 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 PM
  • S

    Sprint moves Q4 earnings report a week earlier to settle concerns

    • Sprint (NYSE:S) closed higher for the first time in a week, up 2.5%, though it's taken some heat: declining 26.5% over the past five days.
    • With investors worried -- despite expectations that Sprint is about to report its first full year gaining subscribers of the past eight -- the company has moved its earnings release a week earlier, to this coming Tuesday, in order to settle questions.
    • It had planned to cut thousands of jobs, and news on the cuts was expected to come before the earnings release -- and now might come alongside it. The company hopes to realize $2.5B in savings through restructuring.
    • Sprint will post results at about 7:30 a.m. ET on Tuesday, and hold a conference call at 8:30 that morning.
    • “We want to hear from them -- because the story is not that bad,” says Wells Fargo's Jennifer Fritzsche, who has a Buy rating on Sprint stock.
    • Previously: SoftBank hurting as Sprint shares, debt hit multiyear lows (Jan. 20 2016)
    • Previously: Sprint tumbles 8.5% to new 52-week low as network plan draws questions (Jan. 19 2016)
    • Previously: Sprint -9.9% as it plans 'radical' network overhaul; tower firms dip (Jan. 15 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 PM | 39 Comments
  • RNST

    Renasant names Waycaster its president, COO

    • The board at Renasant (RNST -3.2%) has unanimously chosen C. Mitchell Waycaster as president and COO of the company and its subsidiary, Renasant Bank.
    • Waycaster has been chief administrative officer and senior executive VP since 2007, and joined the bank in 1979.
    • Renasant has assets of about $7.9B and runs more than 170 banking, mortgage, financial services and insurance offices in the American Southeast.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:55 PM
  • REXX

    Rex Energy suspends preferred dividend

    • Rex Energy (NASDAQ:REXX) -13.3% AH after suspending payment of the quarterly dividend on shares of its 6% Series A convertible perpetual preferred stock.
    • REXX says the dividend suspension creates an additional $2.4M of liquidity per quarter and does not constitute an event of default.
    • REXX shares have shed 28.5% YTD and 72% in the past year.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM | 4 Comments
  • AABA

    Reuters: Yahoo to wait for earnings for strategic steps

    • Yahoo (YHOO +1.8%) isn't rushing key strategic decisions, planning to make its next steps only after its release of quarterly earnings on Feb. 2, Reuters says.
    • Sources suggest the company wants to present a strategic vision and then gauge shareholder reaction before making any big moves.
    • There's some debate about how resistant Yahoo is to calls to sell its core Internet business. The company said it would pursue a tax-free spinoff, but Reuters said the company turned away "several" potential buyers, including private-equity firms.
    • After hours: YHOO -0.5%.
    • Previously: Canyon tells Yahoo it can't waste any more capital (Jan. 15 2016)
    • Previously: More than 1/3 of Yahoo's workforce has left in the last year (Jan. 10 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM | 25 Comments
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power +9.8% after winning $12M China bus contract

    • Ballard Power Systems (BLDP +2.5%) is up 9.8% after hours, following the signing of a $12M equipment supply agreement with Guangdong Synergy Hydrogen Power Technology to provide its FCvelocity-9SSL fuel cell stacks for buses.
    • Guangdong Synergy will work with state-owned automaker Dongfeng Motor, the largest maker of commercial vehicles in China.
    • "We are pleased to see [Dongfeng] supporting the largest planned deployment of fuel cell hybrid commercial vehicles globally," says Ballard CEO Randy MacEwen. "And, this agreement contributes to a record sales order book for Ballard, as we begin 2016."
    • The deal joins $27M in previously announced agreements for heavy-duty power applications in China, covering more than 330 buses.
    • The stock closed yesterday just 12% above its 52-week low.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM | 4 Comments
  • APPS

    Digital Turbine +6.3% after launching new version of Ignite platform

    • Digital Turbine (NASDAQ:APPS) finished today up 6.3%, rebounding from yesterday's 52-week low, with the release of Ignite 2.0, the enhanced version of its app delivery platform.
    • The new version has new tools, the company says, including a set-up "wizard" and improvements in performance and security, along with a new software development kit for easier integration into other applications.
    • Shares had dipped to $0.85 yesterday before closing at $1.02; the stock is down 66.6% over the past year.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: EGHT +5.7%. XNPT +4.2%. SM +3.5%. HTZ +2.7%. ZEN +2.0%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: CSII -20.1%. AMTD -7.0%. LSCC -6.7%. HAIN -4.4%. SBUX -4.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold says 2015 gold, copper production met guidance

    • Barrick Gold (ABX) -2.2% AH after announcing preliminary FY 2015 production of 6.12M oz. of gold, in-line with its updated guidance of 6M-6.15M oz., and 511M lbs. of copper, which also met guidance of 480M-520M lbs.
    • ABX says it expects an average realized gold price of $1,157/oz. for the full year and $1,105/oz. for Q4, and an average realized copper price of $2.37/lb. for the full year and $2.16/lb. for Q4.
    • ABX also says its preliminary analysis indicates potential goodwill impairment charges of ~$1.8B, and asset impairment charges of $1B-$1.2B, primarily related to its Pascua-Lama and Pueblo Viejo gold mines.
    • ABX is expected to report its full quarterly results and final impairment test results on Feb. 17.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 7 Comments
  • LGCY

    Legacy Reserves suspends distributions

    • Legacy Reserves (NASDAQ:LGCY) -14.8% AH after saying it will suspend all distributions; it also approves a 2016 capital budget of $37M.
    • LGCY says its estimated Q4 cash generation was well in excess of its prior $0.15 quarterly distribution, but weaker commodity price forecasts have eroded projected future cash flow generation.
    • LGCY says it expects to be free cash flow positive in 2016 and continues to work through asset sale opportunities to enhance cash flow, leverage metrics and liquidity.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 37 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing to cut back 747 production, take charge

    • "The air cargo market recovery that began in late 2013 has stalled in recent months and slowed demand for the 747-8 Freighter," says Boeing (NYSE:BA) Vice Chairman and CEO of Boeing Commercial Airlines Ray Conner. "We're taking the prudent step to further align production with current market requirements."
    • The most recent data show air freight contracted in November by 1.2% from a year earlier, though passenger demand grew 5.9%.
    • Starting in September, production will be cut from one airplane per month to half a plane. A reduction from 1.3 per month to 1 beginning in March was previously announced.
    • The company will take an after-tax Q4 charge of $569M or $0.84 per share.
    • The stock's lower by 1.2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • MXIM

    Maxim up 3.9% after FQ2 sales beat, light FQ3 guidance

    • Though it beat FQ2 sales estimates and posted in-line EPS, Maxim (NASDAQ:MXIM) is guiding for FQ3 revenue of $535M-$575M and EPS of $0.38-$0.44 (midpoints of $555M and $0.41) vs. a consensus of $568.5M and $0.46. But with shares having gone into earnings less than $2 above a 52-week low of $29.47, markets are giving the company a pass for now.
    • CEO Tunc Doluca: "Our second quarter financial performance was in line with our expectations, and we achieved several milestones in our $180 million cost reduction plan. In our March quarter, we expect continued growth in Automotive, a sequential increase in our Communications & Data Center and Consumer businesses and a seasonal uptick in Industrial." Samsung-related weakness has often been a headwind for Maxim over the last two years - the Galaxy S7 is expected to be unveiled at the Mobile World Congress (runs from Feb. 22-25).
    • Financials: Weighing on FQ2 EPS: Non-GAAP gross margin was 60.5%, -110 bps Q/Q and +20 bps Y/Y, and towards the low end of a 60%-63% guidance range. FQ3 GM guidance is also at 60%-63%. Boosting EPS: Non-GAAP operating expenses fell 13% Y/Y to $186.7M, and $23M was spent on buybacks. Maxim ended FQ2 with $1.77B in cash, and $1B in long-term debt.
    • Shares have risen to $32.25 after hours.
    • FQ2 results, earnings release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • SRCI

    Synergy Resources to launch 10M-share offering

    • Synergy Resources (SYRG) -6.2% AH after announcing a public offering of 10M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.5M shares.
    • SYRG says it plans to use the proceeds to repay amounts borrowed under its revolving credit facility and for general corporate purposes, which may include continued development of its acreage position in the Wattenberg Field in Colorado.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 10 Comments
  • ETFC

    E*Trade slips after inline results

    • Q4 net income of $89M or $0.30 per share vs. $41M and $0.14 one year ago, though last year's Q4 included a negative $59M item.
    • Q4 DARTs of 147K down 6% Q/Q, down 13% Y/Y. Full-year DARTs of 155K vs. 168K in 2014.
    • 3.2M brokerage accounts at year-end, up 13K for the quarter. $288B in total customer assets vs. $290B a year ago. $2.8B in net new brokerage assets added during the quarter.
    • Corporate cash ends quarter at $447M, up $15M Q/Q as a $50M dividend from E*Trade Securities was offset by $50M used for buybacks.
    • Net operating interest income of $285M vs. $279M a year ago. Net interest spread of 2.88% up 19 basis points.
    • Commissions, fees, and service charges of $160M vs. $176M a year ago.
    • Conference call at 5 ET
    • Previously: E*TRADE Financial EPS and revenue in-line (Jan. 21)
    • ETFC -1.2% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • EGHT

    Comms firm 8x8 up 3.9% in late trade after Q3 beats

    • Communications firm 8x8 (EGHT +1.3%) is up 3.9% after hours, following a beat on top and bottom lines after revenues grew 29% and the company grew its mid-market/enterprise service revenues to 50% of the total.
    • Monthly recurring revenue to mid-market/enterprise customers was up 94%, and made up 58% of total MRR.
    • Revenue breakout: Service revenue, $48.95M (up 29.5%); Product revenue, $4.22M (up 18.2%).
    • Non-GAAP gross margin increased slightly, to 83% from the prior 81%. Average monthly service revenue per business customer was $369, up 21% from the prior $305.
    • Cash and equivalents were $155M; cash flow from operating activities was $8.3M.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • VASC

    Vascular Solutions beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • Vascular Solutions (NASDAQ:VASC): Q4 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $38.1M (+13.4% Y/Y) beats by $0.56M.
    • Shares +3.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • SBNY

    Signature Bank raising capital

    • The lender is selling 2.2M shares in a secondary offering. The underwriter greenshoe is for another 330K shares.
    • Signature (NASDAQ:SBNY) has fared better than most, down 9% YTD, but up 19% Y/Y. The stock's lower by 1.4% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • XLNX

    Chip stocks outperform following Xilinx's earnings; AMD leads the way

    • Chip stocks fared well (SOXX +1.5%) on a day the Nasdaq was nearly flat. The gains came after FPGA maker Xilinx (XLNX +8.6%) beat calendar Q4 sales estimates, issued solid Q1 guidance, and published an 8-K filing that has fueled hopes the company will join the ranks of chip firms to be acquired during the industry's M&A wave.
    • Also: Microcontroller and SRAM/NOR flash memory maker Cypress Semi (CY +7.6%) affirmed its Q4 guidance against a backdrop of low expectations.
    • Seeing the biggest gains was AMD (AMD +16.1%), which is two days removed from providing weak Q1 guidance to go with a Q4 sales beat. In spite of the guidance and the largely downbeat analyst commentary that has followed, AMD is now up 7% since the Q4 report arrived. Short-covering is likely helping - 120.4M shares (19% of the float) were shorted as of Dec. 31.
    • Small-cap Xilinx rival Lattice Semi (LSCC +10.8%) was also a standout. Lattice (like Xilinx) has seen its share of M&A speculation, and CEO Darin Billerbeck has suggested he's open to a sale.
    • Other notable gainers include Cavium (CAVM +3.6%), Silicon Motion (SIMO +3.7%), and Knowles (KN +6.5%) - Cavium is exposed to some of the same end-markets as Xilinx. MagnaChip (MX +13.9%) jumped two days after making a positive Q4 pre-announcement. Beaten-down Micron (MU +8%) also rallied strongly, possibly aided by a bullish Morgan Stanley note.
    • On its earnings call (transcript), Xilinx mentioned the automotive market (a strong point for many chip companies, as chip content within cars steadily grows) is expected to see record sales in calendar Q1, and deliver 30% sales growth for FY16 (ends in March). Mobile infrastructure-related sales are expected to rise Q/Q, but deemed unlikely to reach a March 2014 peak anytime soon. CEO Moshe Gavrielov: "[E]verything until 2020 is likely to be of a smaller scale and the next big surge will be driven by 5G."
    • Chip ETFs: SMH, XSD, PSI, SOXL, USD, SOXS, SSG
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 8 Comments
  • SBUX

    Starbucks pulls strong comp in FQ1, guidance doesn't dazzle

    • Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) reports global comparable store sales increased 8% in FQ1. The company is on a consistent track of solid comps. Last year's comp marks were +5% in Q1, +7% in Q2, +7% in Q3, and +8% in Q4.
    • Traffic was 4% higher at Starbucks stores during the quarter.
    • Comp growth by region: Americas and U.S. +9%; EMEA +1%; China/Asia Pacific +5%.
    • The company's operating margin jumped 60 bps to 19.7% as lower dairy and coffee costs kicked in.
    • Starbucks added 528 net new stores during the quarter to reach 23,571 global stores.
    • Full-year FY16 guidance set at $1.87 to 1.89 vs. $1.89 consensus. Q2 FY16 EPS of $0.38 to $0.39 expected.
    • SBUX -3.56% AH to $56.39.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 41 Comments
  • BMR

    BioMed Realty owners approve sale to Blackstone

    • Blackstone is paying $23.75 per share in cash for BioMed Realty Trust (NYSE:BMR), plus a per diem of about $0.003 per share for each day from January 1 until closing. Based on the expected closing date of Jan. 26, stockholders would receive $23.821 per share.
    • The stock closed today at $23.77.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • XNPT

    XenoPort spikes at the close on rumor of possible sale

    • Micro cap XenoPort (NASDAQ:XNPT) spiked at the close to finish up 9% for the day, albeit on below average volume, on a rumor that it is exploring a sale.
    • Its markets one commercial product: HORIZANT (gabapentin enacarbil), for restless legs syndrome (RLS) and postherpetic neuralgia. It is branded as REGNITE in Japan, where Astellas Pharma (OTCPK:ALPMY)(OTCPK:ALPMF) exclusively markets it. It was cleared for the treatment of RLS there in January 2012.
    • Its two main pipeline candidates are XP23829 for psoriasis and multiple sclerosis and XP21279 for Parkinson's disease.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • OIS

    Oil States downgraded at Baird after outperforming market YTD

    • Oil States International (OIS +3%) is downgraded to Neutral from Outperform with a $29 price target, cut from $38, at Robert W. Baird, which says it still likes the company's positioning, balance sheet and strong management team.
    • However, OIS is the only oilfield service stock to outperform the market YTD, and the firm believes the multiple deflation in other stocks provides more potential upside on any seasonal move in the coming months.
    • Baird is trimming its global activity growth outlook across the board to reflect further near-term activity deterioration prior to stabilization and subsequent recovery.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • STRP

    Straight Path +11%; IDT -4% as GeoTeam weighs in on FCC issue

    • Straight Path Communications (NYSEMKT:STRP) is up 11% -- and former parent IDT down 4% -- following a probe by GeoInvesting into the burgeoning controversy over FCC licenses.
    • Kerrisdale Capital and Sinclar Upton Research have raised doubts about radio installations required for Straight Path to receive its 2011 license renewal, suggesting the licenses may have been based on fraudulent premises.
    • Few people are looking at parent firm IDT, the GeoTeam says. If it turns out that IDT lied to the FCC, they say, the fallout won't be limited to Straight Path. A filing by the latter firm indicated that "a significant amount of the equipment that had been installed in connection with the substantial service showings is no longer present at the original locations."
    • GeoTeam says that of 37 sites it contacted, it found no indication of radio equipment.
    • Investor Lloyd Miller has taken increasing stakes in Straight Path this month up to 10.5%, filing a form 3 on Jan. 14 before three more filings this week. Since his Jan. 14 filing, STRP is up 22.9%.
    • Previously: Straight Path makes biggest moves since Halloween short cases (Dec. 22 2015)
    • Previously: Straight Path surges for second day, +26% on court victory (Nov. 25 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 8 Comments
  • XOM

    Crude oil surges 4%-plus on oversold conditions

    • Crude oil futures settled more than 4% higher on the back of perceived oversold conditions, despite a higher than expected inventory build; March WTI jumped 4.2% to settle at $29.53/bbl after trading as high as $30.25, while Brent surged 4.9% to $29.25.
    • Crude prices were supported by the inventory increase in this morning's EIA report, which was less than the API’s report released on Wednesday, says Phil Flynn, senior market analyst at Price Futures Group; also, reports of Libyan oil tanks on fire eased speculation that Libya would be exporting more oil soon.
    • Also supportive for prices, oil production in the lower 48 states edged lower for the first time in seven weeks, “which is at least ‘less bearish’ for the extremely oversupplied global oil market,” says Tyler Richey of The 7:00’s Report.
    • The energy sector is bouncing after hitting a multiyear low yesterday: XOM +1.4%, CVX +2.7%, RDS.A +3.8%, BP +3.7%, TOT +2.3%, STO +4.5%, COP +6.2%, MRO +12.2%, APC +10.3%, OXY +2.1%, EOG +6.4%, PXD +2.7%, APA +8.2%, HES +7%, KMI +15.5%, EPD +3.3%, ETP +6.8%.
    • ETFs: UNG, USO, OIL, XLE, UGAZ, UCO, DGAZ, UWTI, VDE, ERX, OIH, SCO, XOP, BNO, BOIL, GAZ-OLD, DBO, OTC:DWTI, ERY, FCG, DIG, GASL, DTO, DUG, KOLD, BGR, USL, XES, IYE, IEO, UNL, IEZ, DNO, FENY, PXE, PXI, FIF, PXJ, OLO, SZO, NDP, RYE, DCNG, FXN, OLEM, DDG
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 116 Comments
  • AA

    Alcoa says Washington state smelter restart possible

    • Alcoa (AA +5.5%) says its 279K metric tons/year Intalco smelter in Washington state could remain open if power costs decline.
    • "Should the economics change, they could certainly come back," Alcoa VP Christine Keener tells the Platts Aluminum Symposium in Fort Lauderdale, referring to Intalco and the 184K metric tons/year Wenatchee smelter in Washington, which was curtailed last month.
    • The Intalco smelter had been scheduled to be curtailed by the end of Q1 but Alcoa on Tuesday announced a delay until the end of Q2 due to changes in energy and raw materials costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 5 Comments
  • BOX

    Box up 6.8% after CEO, SVP take part in BofA/Merrill webcast

    • This morning, BOX CEO Aaron Levie and platform SVP/chief strategy officer Jeetu Patel took part in a webcast hosted by BofA/Merrill. Box's shares have since posted big gains on a day the Nasdaq is up just 0.3%.
    • Like many other high-beta tech names, Box has been hammered in January. Shares were down 30% on the month going into today, and fell as low as $8.82 yesterday before bouncing. They currently go for a moderate 3.2x estimated FY17 (ends Jan. '17) sales.
    • Profit-taking by shorts could be helping Box out today: 10.2M shares (29% of the float) were shorted as of Dec. 31.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 4 Comments
  • BAC

    Nasty post-earnings price action in BofA

    • The stock has given up another 2.6% today, even as the broader market rallies and its TBTF peers are just modestly lower. Shares are lower by 20% YTD, and 13.4% Y/Y.
    • Holding court at Davos, CEO Brian Moynihan says the job cuts will continue this year after more than 10K reductions in 2015. Total headcount at the bank is 213.3K. The efficiency ratio at BofA for 2015 of 68.6% is far worse than competitors like Citigroup (57%) and Wells Fargo (57.8%)
    • Cost cuts are nice, but revenue growth can also help that ratio. Expect that to remain challenging, however, even as the U.S. economy improves, says CFO Paul Donofrio.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 72 Comments
  • SHOP

    Shopify up 13.4% following bullish Wedbush coverage

    • Two days after Morgan Stanley upgraded Shopify (NYSE:SHOP) to Overweight in response to the company's recent selloff, Wedbush's Gil Luria has lunched coverage with an Outperform rating and $25 target.
    • Shares have surged above $23 on volume of 904K shares (well above a 3-month daily average of 508K). They were down 21% in 2016 going into today.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • OCSL

    Fifth Street posts modest gain after fee cut, preliminary results

    • Fifth Street Finance (FSC +1.8%) last night announced a 25 basis point cut in the base management fee charged by Fifth Street Asset Management (OTCPK:FSAM +3.2%). The reaction by activist investor RiverNorth Capital - which has called for an end to the management agreement - is not yet known.
    • While pre-announced NII roughly met expectations, the dip in NAV was greater than had been expected, say KBW's Greg Mason and Troy Ward. And if 40% of the fall in NAV was due to spread widening, that means 60% was related to credit issues.
    • As for the fee cut, it amounts to about $0.03 of incremental EPS per year, says SunTrust's Douglas Mewhirter, a not insignificant amount. He reiterates his Buy rating, with the fee reduction adding to share buybacks as catalysts given the stock's low valuation - about 60% of book value.
    • While FSC is higher today, it's underperforming the broader BDC sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 8 Comments
  • PDCE

    PDC Energy says 2015 production rose 65% Y/Y

    • PDC Energy (PDCE +2.8%) is higher after reporting a 65% increase in 2015 production over the prior-year level, totaling 15.4M boe last year (42.1K boe/day).
    • PDCE says it continues to see encouraging results related to increased drilling efficiency, completion technology and reduced line pressure in the Wattenberg field.
    • PDCE also says it ended FY 2015 with 272.8M boe in proved reserves, up ~9% Y/Y, consisting of 60% liquid and 40% natural gas.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • THS

    TreeHouse Foods roars back after equity raise; Susquehanna raises estimates

    • TreeHouse Foods (THS +9%) rallies back with vigor after a sharp loss yesterday.
    • Volume on the packaged food stock is over 10X normal activity following the announcement yesterday that the company would sell 11.54M shares at $65 per share to help fund its ConAgra's Private Brands business.
    • Susquehanna raises EPS estimates on TreeHouse after resetting its model down from a $1B equity raise.
    • The investment firm calls guidance for an increase of only 100bp of EBIT margin expansion at ConAgra's private label business conservative as the company's "best practices" works on top of synergy benefits.
    • "Our new FY16 EPS is $3.12 vs. $3.05 before and vs. guidance of $2.95-3.10; our FY17 EPS estimate is now $4.08 vs. $3.95 before, and FY18 is $5.08 vs. $4.90 before," reads the analyst note.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • CHK

    Only CHK, GST, UPL face potential credit issues before 2018, analyst says

    • A new report from Sterne Agee CRT analyst Tim Rezvan suggests the situation for oil and gas E&P stocks is not as bad as the market fears for many companies.
    • After studying liquidity positions of the E&P names under the firm's coverage, Rezvan concludes that only Chesapeake Energy (CHK +4%), Gastar Exploration (GST +13.2%) and Ultra Petroleum (UPL +25.7%) face potential credit issues prior to 2018.
    • Conversely, Rezvan says Oasis Petroleum (OAS +8.5%) and Whiting Petroleum (WLL +11.3%) maintain strong liquidity despite sharp equity underperformance and can withstand the reduction in credit facilities expected this spring from lending banks feeling stress in their energy loan portfolios.
    • The firm has Buy ratings on OAS and WLL, and Neutral ratings on CHK, GST and UPL.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 20 Comments
  • KUTV

    Ku6 media -1.8% as it breaks even for first time

    • Ku6 Media (NASDAQ:KUTV) is 1.8% lower after posting near-breakeven earnings (profit per ADS of $0.00 on net profit of $0.08M) for the first time -- still up sequentially from Q3's net loss of $0.64M.
    • Total revenues grew 7.5% in Q4, leading fiscal year revenues to grow 27% from 2014.
    • The company is making a move into virtual reality, it says: Q4 was a milestone "as we achieved our first quarterly break-even and determined Ku6's new strategy for the years ahead, which is to become a leading virtual reality internet content provider," says CEO Feng Gao.
    • The firm had $7.7M in cash and equivalents as of the end of 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • NFX

    Newfield Exploration wins Outperform rating at Imperial Capital

    • Newfield Exploration (NFX +4.4%) is initiated with an Outperform rating and $27 price target at Imperial Capital, which foresees continued weakness in the independent E&P sector but NFX's positioning for a "lower for longer" scenario should help it to continue to outperform peers.
    • Imperial says NFX boasts a strong balance sheet and a large acreage footprint in the core Oklahoma STACK and SCOOP plays, which offers the company "years of high IRR growth opportunity.”
    • NFX has the staying power to survive a long commodity downturn, the firm says, and improved performance as well as lower costs should drive production growth as well as highly economic returns in a recovery.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • MU

    Micron +6.3%; Morgan Stanley calls valuation historically low

    • Morgan Stanley's Joseph Moore (Overweight rating, $18 target) believes Micron's (NASDAQ:MU) valuation is approaching the levels seen at its 2012 bottom on a price/book, EV/sales, trailing P/E, and replacement value basis. He sees the stock having downside protection as long as Micron can manage balance sheet risks.
    • Moore still thinks Micron's fundamentals will remain weak in 1H16, but considers a 2H16 recovery possible. "We think that recent spot market stability in DRAM shows that there isn't panic in the market, but we do expect further weakness to evolve short term." He also predicts Micron's cost structure will improve significantly in the coming months.
    • Like many other former tech high-flyers, Micron has been clobbered in the first weeks of 2016 - shares were hit last week following Intel's earnings, and made an intraday low of $9.31 yesterday before bouncing. And like a slew of other beaten-up names, Micron is rallying today on healthy volume (35.8M shares vs. a 3-month daily average of 23.8M).

    • Rice says GE has enjoyed strong demand in China and other countries where growth rates have slowed, benefiting from larger-scale infrastructure projects, particularly in energy, that continue to move ahead.

  • ALKS

    Alkermes' lead product candidate flunks two late-stage studies in MDD; shares slump 30% premarket

    • Two Phase 3 clinical trials, FORWARD-3 and FORWARD-4, assessing Alkermes plc's (NASDAQ:ALKS) lead product candidate, Fast Track-tagged ALKS 5461, for the treatment of major depressive disorder (MDD) in patients who have had an inadequate response to standard therapies for clinical depression, failed to beat placebo as measured by the change from baseline on the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS).
    • FORWARD-3 enrolled 429 MDD patients. No treatment effect (2mg/2mg dose) was observed due to a significant placebo effect, a common occurrence in MDD studies.
    • FORWARD-4 assessed two dose levels of ALKS 5461 (2mg/2mg and 0.5mg/0.5mg) in 385 MDD patients. There was a clear trend toward efficacy in the 2mg/2mg cohort and post hoc analyses achieved statistical significance on the MADRS endpoint. The company believes this provides supportive evidence of efficacy, although post hoc analyses typically mean that the data have been parsed to provide the desired result.
    • A third Phase 3 study, FORWARD-5, is ongoing. Based on the results in F-3 and F-4, patient enrollment in F-5 will be increased and the statistical analysis plan updated. Alkermes will inform investors later this quarter on the projected completion date of the trial.
    • ALKS 5461 is a once-daily, orally administered formulation of samidorphan and buprenorphine that is designed to rebalance brain function that is dysregulated in the state of depression.
    • MDD strikes ~17M Americans each year. Most do not respond adequately to antidepressant therapy.
    • Shares are down 30% premarket on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 AM | 4 Comments

    • Also reversing from early green prints were Asian markets, all of which closed sharply lower on the session. Europe's up just under 1% ahead of what could be more easing announced by the ECB.
